wasGeneratedBy.description: Subject ID: 1_4. A sine wave stimulation applied at 20Hz using 4.5V (peak-to-peak) amplitude. Note: this is not the actual amplitude measured on the oscilloscope, which will be somewhat smaller (calibration factors are frequency-dependent and will be reported separately, after the calibration is completed). For the employed electrode configuration, 1V translates into 36 V/cm at the location of neurons. Neuron action potentials were visualized using the voltage-sensitive fluorescent dye, FluoVolt. All experiments were performed in a standard physiological solution containing (in mM): 140 NaCl, 5.4 KCl, 2 CaCl2, 1.5 MgCl2, 10 D-glucose, and 10 HEPES (pH 7.3, 290-300 mOsm/kg).
wasGeneratedBy.name: 20Hz_sine_stimulation_4.5V
